<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>This is your quarterly tutorial on making sure the Brew hits your inbox every day, because like family reunion potato salad, email can’t be totally trusted.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are the steps to follow for a seamless direct-to-inbox experience.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/12/uber-ceo-threatens-pause-service-california-worker-disputes-arent-resolved?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber Could Say Later, Dude to California
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Uber car in a garage" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDY4L3ViZXJfY2FyX2luX2FfZ2FyYWdlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The past few days have been swervy for <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">ride hailing</span> food delivery giant Uber. And if things aren’t resolved soon, it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/12/uber-may-shut-down-temporarily-in-california.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">might deprive</a> the people of California of a quick way to get from the beach to the taqueria after a couple AMFs. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For years, Uber and Lyft have been sparring with their home state over how to classify their drivers. In 2019, the state passed AB5, a law that requires companies to treat gig economy workers core to their business as employees, not individual contractors. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Employee status makes workers eligible for benefits like minimum wage, overtime pay, and unemployment insurance. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In June, California AG Xavier Becerra <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/24/21302140/california-ag-uber-lyft-drivers-classify-employees-preliminary-injunction?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">requested</a> a preliminary injunction to force Uber and Lyft to comply with AB5. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Which brings us to this week </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, anticipating a Superior Court judge’s decision on the injunction, Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi penned a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/10/opinion/uber-ceo-dara-khosrowshahi-gig-workers-deserve-better.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT op-ed</a> arguing that the government should find a “third way” to treat gig economy workers instead of the binary choice (independent contractor or employee) offered currently. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He suggested that gig economy companies should have to create separate funds for workers to use on benefits of their choosing. The ride-hailing giants maintain that classifying drivers as employees would reduce flexibility, limit availability, and jack up prices. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Monday night, the judge <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/10/21362460/uber-lyft-drivers-employees-california-court-ruling?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> Becerra’s injunction. “Drivers are central, not tangential, to Uber and Lyft’s entire ride-hailing business,” Judge Ethan Schulman wrote. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The companies have a 10-day window to appeal, and they say they will. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Here’s the kicker: </strong>Khosrowshahi said on MSNBC yesterday that if the appeal fails, Uber would likely pause service in California until the November election. That’s when voters will weigh in on a ballot measure backed by Uber and Lyft that would exempt drivers for app-based transportation and delivery companies from AB5. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>we’ll find out if Uber’s appeal is accepted by the middle of next week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Lyft, which does not have an Uber Eats food delivery equivalent, said revenue dipped 61% in Q2. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/12/sp-briefly-tops-alltime-high-epic-rebound?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Oh Hi There All-Time Highs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Bears waving" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=558 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xNT2CcLjhbI0U/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Bears waving" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xNT2CcLjhbI0U/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a months-long climb that would make even Alex Honnold proud, the S&P 500 finally completed its epic turnaround yesterday, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/11/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">briefly reaching</a> its all-time closing high before finishing 0.4% below its February 19 record. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>If investors are looking for a place to address their thank you cards, look no further than the usual suspects—Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft accounted for </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/11927118-382c-48c3-a52b-451739b2b330?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over a third</a></span><span> of the index’s big rise yesterday.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check: </strong>Because the pandemic gutted smaller companies more than larger ones, the Russell 2000, which tracks small-cap companies, is still catching up to its more muscular cousin. This earnings season Russell companies lost $1.1 billion on aggregate (compared to nearly $18 billion in profits last year). S&P earnings have <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/83d0c41f-be54-48e3-89fe-e78cda5f319c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">only declined 34%</a>, according to data from FactSet cited by the FT. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Previous 20%+ drops in the S&P took an average of 4 years to claw back from. But thanks to the Fed’s actions to keep markets humming, stimulus from Capitol Hill, and Big Tech’s breakneck growth, the S&P went from peak to 34% collapse in March back to the top in <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-12/to-the-brink-and-back-in-175-days-the-s-p-500-rallies-to-record?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just 175 days</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/12/rei-makes-plans-sell-corporate-campus-just-built?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Merrells Paradise Never Gets Off the Ground
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<img alt="REI HQ" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDY1L3JlaV9ocS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NBBJ</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know when you put the final brick on a Lego build and then your baby cousin comes in and Hulk smashes it to pieces? That’s what the pandemic did to REI’s HQ.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the outdoor retail cooperative <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/08/12/rei-seattle-headquarters-commercial-real-estate/?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=wp_business&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced plans</a> to sell the lavish corporate campus it had just finished building near Seattle. Execs said employees were able to collaborate remotely better the company initially expected...so a massive physical HQ just wasn’t worth the cost. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>In 2016, REI <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/outdoor-retailer-rei-building-the-most-outdoorsy-hq-ever-11581417001?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set out</a> to create the corporate version of Pandora from <em>Avatar</em>, installing outdoor stairs and bridges, firepits, and rooftop terraces on an eight-acre campus. The goal was to move most corporate workers in by July. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But then the coronavirus arrived, REI employees began filling up their Hydro Flasks from home, and the company projected a 30% decline in 2020 revenue. “The dramatic events of 2020 have challenged us to reexamine and rethink every aspect of our business and many of the assumptions of the past,” CEO Eric Artz told employees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Companies are quickly going from HQ2 to HQ0.</p>

</table>
<img alt="Microsoft's new phone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDY3L21pY3Jvc29mdF9zX25ld19waG9uZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Microsoft</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well kinda. In a return to the mobile device business after more than four years away, Microsoft began taking orders for its new <a href="https://apnews.com/37019b509699cdc877bcf6b701e3d69e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Surface Duo</a> yesterday.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The specs</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the name implies, the Surface Duo has two screens connected via a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-12/microsoft-surface-duo-phone-goes-on-sale-starting-at-1-399?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">360-degree hinge</a> enabling both horizontal and vertical usage. The device runs on Google’s Android operating system and allows users to open two different apps on each screen.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">For example: </strong></span><span>You can read the Brew on one, while bumping our </span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/5s8443tfYUq3LLARJwGeYP?si=euyGibkgSO21z2zShLW3hQ&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify playlist</a></span><span> on the other. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“It’s thin, it’s sleek, it’s probably one of the sexiest devices we’ve built,” Microsoft’s chief product officer Panos Panay said yesterday with no regard to Clippy’s feelings. And Microsoft wants users to pay for that sexiness—the Surface Duo clocks in at a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/12/21364633/microsoft-surface-duo-release-date-pricing-features-specs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bold $1,399</a>, even as competitors Apple and Google roll out feature-packed budget phones in the $400 range. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>We’ll be watching how Microsoft’s premium release performs in a less-than-favorable economic environment. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/12/media-titan-sumner-redstone-dies-97?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sumner Redstone Dies at 97
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mogul, tycoon, titan...Sumner Redstone was a media one. Redstone <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/08/12/375143072/media-titan-sumner-redstone-who-made-viacom-a-global-empire-dies-at-97?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">died</a> Tuesday night at his home in Los Angeles. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Redstone shaped the last century of media.</strong> He turned his father’s chain of New England drive-in theaters into the globe-spanning ViacomCBS empire, which includes Showtime, MTV, BET, Comedy Central, the studio Paramount, and Simon & Schuster publishing. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He’s known for seeing the promise in MTV in the 1980s and taking it global. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Redstone acquired Viacom in 1987 in a knock-down, drag-out hostile takeover, then wrestled Barry Diller for Paramount in 1994 and pinned him. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">He is not known for politeness.</strong> His brass-knuckle business dealings often involved lawsuits, aggressive tactics, and one...<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2012/09/23/business/media/philippe-dauman-the-man-who-would-be-redstone.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dental incident</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The NYT’s Edmund Lee <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/12/business/media/sumner-redstone-legacy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> of Redstone’s sharp differences from the cucumber-chill media execs of 2020: “He wasn’t so much an innovator as he was a maximum opportunist. He didn’t invent new forms of entertainment; he used cagey maneuvers to build an empire.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Sumner's daughter Shari now <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-12/after-years-of-fighting-shari-redstone-stands-alone-atop-empire?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stands alone</a> at the top of an empire in flux. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F12%2Fmedia-titan-sumner-redstone-dies-97" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Redstone+shaped+the+last+century+of+entertainment+and+media%2C+but+he+wasn%E2%80%99t+known+for+politeness&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/12/media-titan-sumner-redstone-dies-97&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>

</th>

<font color="#000000">

</h1>
</td>

<img alt="A chamber orchestra" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDQ2L2NhcHRpb25fY29udGVzdF9jYXJ0b29uXzEucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Evan Lian</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Top prize:</strong> "This concert could have been an email"—Laia Valdespino from Peru</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Second place:</strong> "Sorry to interrupt, but does anyone want a MacBook Pro?"—Jack in Madison, CT </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Third place: </strong>"My keyboard doesn’t have a C# key..."—Rick from Edmonds, WA</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Dishonorable mention: </strong>"More barn!"—whoever wrote this...what? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This was fun. Let's do it again sometime! If you are a cartoonist interested in providing submissions for our Caption Contest, please fill out <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/pI4kODxC?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this form</a> and we'll get back to you with details.</p>

WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-12/airbnb-revenue-tanks-67-in-second-quarter-ipo-planned-for-2020?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Airbnb</a></span><span> revenue fell 67% last quarter, per documents seen by Bloomberg. Its adjusted loss came to $400 million.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.scmp.com/tech/big-tech/article/3097095/tencent-posts-quarterly-earnings-increase-back-games-us-wechat-ban?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tencent</a></span><span>, the Chinese internet giant, reported strong earnings during the pandemic, and said a potential U.S. ban on its WeChat messaging service wouldn’t significantly hurt revenue.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-school-reopenings-new-jersey-fdad6a94-8735-475a-952c-99345626647f.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Jersey</a></span><span> is allowing in-person schooling this fall.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/12/technology/personaltech/tested-facebook-reels-tiktok-clone-dud.html?smid=tw-share&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Instagram Reels</a></span><span>, Facebook’s answer to TikTok, gets a bad review from the NYT.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.courier-journal.com/story/sports/horses/horse-racing/2020/08/12/kentucky-derby-2020-limited-fans-churchill-downs-historic-race/3292270001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Churchill Downs</a></span><span> will allow 23,000 spectators max (about 14% capacity) at the Kentucky Derby on Sept. 5. </span><span><a href="https://www.espn.com/golf/story/_/id/29646149/november-masters-golf-tournament-augusta-national-held-guests-spectators?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Masters</a></span><span>, kicking off Nov. 12, will be held without fans.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">

<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every other week on Thursdays, we share a few of our favorite reads.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Business books aren't always snoozefests. These wild stories of corporate scandals will have you flipping pages like you're devouring a Stephen King thriller.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780316436472?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Billion Dollar Whale</em></a></span><span> by Tom Wright and Bradley Hope tackles one of the most high-profile white collar crimes in history, Malaysia’s 1MDB scandal. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780812985795?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Black Edge</em></a></span><span> by Sheelah Kolhatkar dives into Wall Street’s shadowy world of insider trading and the billionaire hedge fund manager who inspired Showtime’s </span><span><em>Billions</em></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780525431992?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Bad Blood</em></a></span><span> by John Carreyrou exposes the lies and secrets of Theranos, one of Silicon Valley’s hottest startups in the early 2010s. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781591846604?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Smartest Guys in the Room</em></a></span><span> by Bethany McLean and Peter Elkind tells the unbelievable story of Enron’s high-profile crash and burn in the early 2000s. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Browse our earlier Bookshelf recommendations <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nUber Could Say Later, Dude to California\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Uber car in a garage\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDY4L3ViZXJfY2FyX2luX2FfZ2FyYWdlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe past few days have been swervy for \u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003eride hailing\u003c/span\u003e food delivery giant Uber. And if things aren’t resolved soon, it \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/12/uber-may-shut-down-temporarily-in-california.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emight deprive\u003c/a\u003e the people of California of a quick way to get from the beach to the taqueria after a couple AMFs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow we got here \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor years, Uber and Lyft have been sparring with their home state over how to classify their drivers. In 2019, the state passed AB5, a law that requires companies to treat gig economy workers core to their business as employees, not individual contractors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEmployee status makes workers eligible for benefits like minimum wage, overtime pay, and unemployment insurance. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn June, California AG Xavier Becerra \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/24/21302140/california-ag-uber-lyft-drivers-classify-employees-preliminary-injunction?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequested\u003c/a\u003e a preliminary injunction to force Uber and Lyft to comply with AB5. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhich brings us to this week \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, anticipating a Superior Court judge’s decision on the injunction, Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi penned a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/10/opinion/uber-ceo-dara-khosrowshahi-gig-workers-deserve-better.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT op-ed\u003c/a\u003e arguing that the government should find a “third way” to treat gig economy workers instead of the binary choice (independent contractor or employee) offered currently. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe suggested that gig economy companies should have to create separate funds for workers to use on benefits of their choosing. The ride-hailing giants maintain that classifying drivers as employees would reduce flexibility, limit availability, and jack up prices. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Monday night, the judge \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/10/21362460/uber-lyft-drivers-employees-california-court-ruling?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e Becerra’s injunction. “Drivers are central, not tangential, to Uber and Lyft’s entire ride-hailing business,” Judge Ethan Schulman wrote. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe companies have a 10-day window to appeal, and they say they will. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHere’s the kicker: \u003c/strong\u003eKhosrowshahi said on MSNBC yesterday that if the appeal fails, Uber would likely pause service in California until the November election. That’s when voters will weigh in on a ballot measure backed by Uber and Lyft that would exempt drivers for app-based transportation and delivery companies from AB5. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewe’ll find out if Uber’s appeal is accepted by the middle of next week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eLyft, which does not have an Uber Eats food delivery equivalent, said revenue dipped 61% in Q2. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter a months-long climb that would make even Alex Honnold proud, the S\u0026P 500 finally completed its epic turnaround yesterday, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/11/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebriefly reaching\u003c/a\u003e its all-time closing high before finishing 0.4% below its February 19 record. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIf investors are looking for a place to address their thank you cards, look no further than the usual suspects—Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft accounted for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/11927118-382c-48c3-a52b-451739b2b330?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eover a third\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of the index’s big rise yesterday.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check: \u003c/strong\u003eBecause the pandemic gutted smaller companies more than larger ones, the Russell 2000, which tracks small-cap companies, is still catching up to its more muscular cousin. This earnings season Russell companies lost $1.1 billion on aggregate (compared to nearly $18 billion in profits last year). S\u0026P earnings have \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/83d0c41f-be54-48e3-89fe-e78cda5f319c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonly declined 34%\u003c/a\u003e, according to data from FactSet cited by the FT. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003ePrevious 20%+ drops in the S\u0026P took an average of 4 years to claw back from. But thanks to the Fed’s actions to keep markets humming, stimulus from Capitol Hill, and Big Tech’s breakneck growth, the S\u0026P went from peak to 34% collapse in March back to the top in \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-12/to-the-brink-and-back-in-175-days-the-s-p-500-rallies-to-record?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust 175 days\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNBBJ\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou know when you put the final brick on a Lego build and then your baby cousin comes in and Hulk smashes it to pieces? That’s what the pandemic did to REI’s HQ.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the outdoor retail cooperative \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/08/12/rei-seattle-headquarters-commercial-real-estate/?utm_source=feedly\u0026utm_medium=referral\u0026utm_campaign=wp_business\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced plans\u003c/a\u003e to sell the lavish corporate campus it had just finished building near Seattle. Execs said employees were able to collaborate remotely better the company initially expected...so a massive physical HQ just wasn’t worth the cost. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2016, REI \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/outdoor-retailer-rei-building-the-most-outdoorsy-hq-ever-11581417001?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset out\u003c/a\u003e to create the corporate version of Pandora from \u003cem\u003eAvatar\u003c/em\u003e, installing outdoor stairs and bridges, firepits, and rooftop terraces on an eight-acre campus. The goal was to move most corporate workers in by July. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut then the coronavirus arrived, REI employees began filling up their Hydro Flasks from home, and the company projected a 30% decline in 2020 revenue. “The dramatic events of 2020 have challenged us to reexamine and rethink every aspect of our business and many of the assumptions of the past,” CEO Eric Artz told employees.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eCompanies are quickly going from HQ2 to HQ0.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" In a return to the mobile device business after more than four years away, Microsoft began taking orders for its new \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/37019b509699cdc877bcf6b701e3d69e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSurface Duo\u003c/a\u003e yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe specs\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the name implies, the Surface Duo has two screens connected via a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-12/microsoft-surface-duo-phone-goes-on-sale-starting-at-1-399?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e360-degree hinge\u003c/a\u003e enabling both horizontal and vertical usage. style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMogul, tycoon, titan...Sumner Redstone was a media one. Redstone \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/12/375143072/media-titan-sumner-redstone-who-made-viacom-a-global-empire-dies-at-97?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edied\u003c/a\u003e Tuesday night at his home in Los Angeles. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRedstone shaped the last century of media.\u003c/strong\u003e He turned his father’s chain of New England drive-in theaters into the globe-spanning ViacomCBS empire, which includes Showtime, MTV, BET, Comedy Central, the studio Paramount, and Simon \u0026 Schuster publishing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe’s known for seeing the promise in MTV in the 1980s and taking it global. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRedstone acquired Viacom in 1987 in a knock-down, drag-out hostile takeover, then wrestled Barry Diller for Paramount in 1994 and pinned him. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHe is not known for politeness.\u003c/strong\u003e His brass-knuckle business dealings often involved lawsuits, aggressive tactics, and one...\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2012/09/23/business/media/philippe-dauman-the-man-who-would-be-redstone.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edental incident\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe NYT’s Edmund Lee \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/12/business/media/sumner-redstone-legacy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e of Redstone’s sharp differences from the cucumber-chill media execs of 2020: “He wasn’t so much an innovator as he was a maximum
